intro: Xylopia spruceana, commonly known as the West African nutmeg or African star anise, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, dark brown fruits that resemble those of star anise. The plant produces small, white flowers and has opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, while its bark contains compounds with potential medicinal properties. Xylopia spruceana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
